meaningMnemonic:
You do the <kanji>build</kanji>ing to <kanji>establish</kanji> something. This whole process is called <vocabulary>construction</vocabulary>!

建設 is a pretty formal word for construction, focusing on the action or process of <vocabulary>constructing</vocabulary> rather than the structure itself. It’s often used for large construction projects, like malls, dams, or bridges. In some contexts, it can also refer to the <vocabulary>establishment</vocabulary> of significant entities, like a new state.
readingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well.
